name: reference sample
definition: A material sample derived from cells or tissue representing a physiologically or phenotypically normal state.

name: abnormal sample
definition: A material sample derived from cells or tissue representing an observed or suspected physiologically, genomically or phenotypically abnormal state.

name: neoplastic sample
definition: A material sample derived from neoplastic cells or tissue.

name: cancer cell line sample
definition: A neoplastic sample derived from a cancer cell line.

name: metastasis sample
definition: A neoplastic sample derived from a cancer metastasis (not from a primary tumor).

name: primary tumor sample
definition: A neoplastic sample derived from a primary tumor (not from a cancer metastasis).

name: recurrent tumor sample
definition: A neoplastic sample derived from a recurrent tumor (not from a primary occurrence of a neoplasm).

name: Affected
definition: Skin region is determined to be affected by a skin disease.

name: Normal
definition: The area within a sample that is represented by non-tumor tissue.

name: Organoid
definition: A three dimensional mass comprised of a cultured cell or tissue sample that resembles an in vivo tissue or organ. Organoids are grown in vitro from a combination of cells or tissue fragments cultured in medium containing a variety of biochemical factors.

name: Tumor
definition: A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination.

name: Tumoroid
definition: A three dimensional mass comprised of a cultured tumor cell or tumor sample that resembles an in vivo tumor. Tumoroid are grown in vitro from a combination of cells or tissue fragments cultured in medium containing a variety of biochemical factors.
